result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (6th) and Operating w/ PAC (6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Randall G Varese was found guilty of OWI (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentence he is already serving.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay fine and costs totaling $2,252.00.
  25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia.

Pay all court obligations and supervision fees. 
Comply with any other counseling. 
Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections. 
DNA sample if not provided.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on January 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Randall G Varese in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:22 AM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Address is verified.

Matter is on for a plea hearing.

There is a plea agreement. Defendant will be pleading to Count 1. Count 2 would be dismissed. State recommends 6 years of prison, 3 yrs initial confinement, 3 yrs extended supervision. Defense is free to argue. Parties anticipate the Court to order a PSI.

Atty Drengler concurs.
Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Drengler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.
BAC: .175
Defense concurs this will be 6th offense.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: OWI 6th
Count 2: Dismissed

BY THE COURT:
Court orders a PSI.

Attorneys are to contact the judicial assistant to find a plea date immediately after this hearing.

Bailiff will provide the eligible voting notification.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is continued.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court regarding bond, is not sure if Defendant has signed up for the pretrial supervision program.

Defendant indicates that he has signed up for the program.
